Penjualan Lesu Gegara Perang Dagang, Caterpillar PHK 120 Buruh
05 Nov 2019, 05:42 by Herdi Alif Al Hikam


Ilustrasi. Foto: Pradita Utama

Jakarta - Perusahaan alat berat asal Amerika Serikat (AS) memutuskan untuk melakukan PHK kepada 120 pekerjanya. Keputusan ini diambil imbas pemangkasan produksi karena jatuhnya penjualan produk.Juru bicara Caterpillar, Kenny, menyatakan bahwa PHK terjadi pada pabrik ekskavator hidrolik di Victoria, Texas yang memiliki total 820 pekerja. PHK kepada 120 pekerja dilakukan pada 1 November lalu.Kenny sendiri tidak bisa memastikan apakah pengurangan produksi ini juga akan menyebabkan pengurangan tenaga kerja di fasilitas lain."Caterpillar mengambil berbagai tindakan di fasilitas globalnya untuk menyelaraskan produksi dengan permintaan," ucap Kenny dikutip dari Reuters, Selasa (5/11/2019).Pada bulan Oktober, Caterpillar memang berencana mengambil langkah untuk memangkas produksi. Pasalnya, penjualan turun pada semua segmen produk di sebagian besar wilayah tiga bulan terakhir.Penjualan di Asia-Pasifik saja yang menjadi pasar terbesar ketiga mereka sudah turun 13%. Saat ini, Caterpillar menghadapi penurunan permintaan di Tiongkok. Belum lagi persaingan dari pabrikan domestik yang mulai berani memangkas harga. Sementara itu, pendapatan Caterpillar di Amerika Utara turun hampir 3%. Ketegangan perdagangan dunia disebut membuat pelanggan Caterpillar lebih waspada dan makin hitung-hitungan untuk pengeluaran modal besar dalam membeli barang. Caterpillar berharap agar iklim yang penuh ketidakpastian ini bisa cepat menghilang.Buruh pun mulai kalang kabut. Menurut penuturan Henry Guajardo yang menjalankan sebuah agen pengembangan tenaga kerja lokal yang didanai negara, Workforce Solution, karyawan yang baru di-PHK Caterpillar semuanya adalah pekerja produksi. Henry menyatakan sejak Caterpillar melakukan PHK di pabrik Victoria, puluhan pekerja berbondong datang ke kantornya. Mereka mencari bantuan untuk tetap memiliki mata pencaharian.Sebelum Caterpillar, pabrikan lain juga sudah melakukan pemangkasan jumlah pekerja, alasannya pun sama, lemahnya permintaan. Bulan lalu, pabrikan peralatan pertanian Deere & Co mengumumkan PHK untuk 163 pekerja manufakturnya.Sebagai informasi, riset analisis dari Moody's Analytics memprediksikan bahwa perang dagang bisa membuat 300 ribu pekerja kehilangan pekerjaannya di Amerika Serikat.Simak Video "PHK Massal Karyawan, Bukalapak Coba Kejar Profit"[Gambas:Video 20detik](fdl/fdl)

Sluggish sales of trade war, Caterpillar laid off 120 workers
05 Nov 2019, 05:42 by Herdi Alif Al Hikam


Illustration. Photo: Pradita Utama

Jakarta - Heavy equipment company from the United States (US) has decided to lay off 120 workers. This decision was taken as a result of production cuts due to the fall in product sales. Caterpillar's spokesman, Kenny, stated that layoffs occurred at a hydraulic excavator factory in Victoria, Texas which had a total of 820 workers. "The Caterpillar took various actions at its global facilities to align production with demand," Kenny himself could not confirm whether the reduction in production would also cause a reduction in labor at other facilities. "Caterpillar took various actions at its global facilities to align production with demand," Kenny was quoted as saying. Tuesday (11/5/2019). In October, Caterpillar did plan to take steps to cut production. This is because sales have fallen in all product segments in most regions over the past three months. Sales in Asia-Pacific alone, which is the third largest market, have fallen 13%. At present, Caterpillar is facing a decline in demand in China. Not to mention competition from domestic manufacturers who are starting to dare to cut prices. Meanwhile, Caterpillar's revenue in North America fell by almost 3%. The tensions of world trade are said to make Caterpillar customers more alert and more calculating for large capital expenditures in buying goods. Caterpillar hopes that this climate of uncertainty can quickly disappear. Work begins to fade. According to Henry Guajardo who runs a state-funded local labor development agency, Workforce Solution, the new employees laid off by Caterpillar are all production workers. Henry stated that since Caterpillar had laid off at the Victoria factory, dozens of workers had flocked to his office. They are looking for help to keep their livelihoods. Before Caterpillar, other manufacturers have also cut down the number of workers, the reason is the same, weak demand. Last month, agricultural equipment manufacturer Deere & Co. announced layoffs for 163 manufacturing workers. For information, analytical research from Moody's Analytics predicts that a trade war could cause 300 thousand workers to lose their jobs in the United States.
